title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the requirements for the CrossCulturalNarrativeAnalyzer tool, including the types of literary works to be analyzed, the cultural and linguistic diversity to be covered, the desired analysis outputs, and the target users.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the data pipeline, analysis engines, user interfaces, and integration with external data sources and libraries. Consider the following aspects: 1) Data ingestion and preprocessing for different file formats and languages, 2) Natural Language Processing (NLP) and machine learning models for text analysis, 3) Scalable and distributed architecture for handling large volumes of data, 4) User interfaces for data exploration, analysis, and visualization, 5) Integration with external data sources (e.g., literary databases, cultural knowledge bases), 6) Security and privacy considerations for handling sensitive cultural data, 7) Deployment and DevOps strategies for continuous integration and delivery.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Preprocessing
description: Implement the data ingestion and preprocessing components, including support for various file formats, character encodings, and language-specific text processing.

title: Implement Analysis Engines
description: Develop the analysis engines for identifying common themes, unique cultural elements, and potential for cross-cultural adaptation, leveraging natural language processing and machine learning techniques.

title: Build User Interfaces
description: Design and implement the user interfaces for inputting literary works, configuring analysis parameters, and visualizing analysis results.
